intro: Adenocarpus intermedius var. bracteatus, commonly known as the bracteated burrweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces small, hairy pods that contain several seeds, typical of the genus Adenocarpus. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its unique foliage and floral structure.
